last_phrase: In conclusion, Donato's discourse on human magnetism highlights the existence of genuine phenomena despite the proliferation of trickery and counterfeiting in the field of magnetism. He emphasizes the essential qualities of a good subject, which include complete abolition of will, docility to all possible suggestions, and the ability to go from simple absence to complete loss of consciousness. Furthermore, he assures the public that when performed by an expert operator, magnetic fascination does not pose any danger to the health of the subjects. Although the concept of double vision and increased visual faculties are still subject to debate, Donato's findings remain groundbreaking, and his approach to the study of magnetism has led to extraordinary results.
